Name: ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Crushed rock mixes proposed for use on specified works shall be registered in accordance with VicRoads Code of Practice for Registration of Crushed Rock Mix Designs as listed in Section 175.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Mix Design VicRoads Approval
FREQUENCY: Check prior to placing material
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Material should be spread to minimize number of jointsTransverse joints shall be offset from one layer to next by not less than 2 metres
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. Cl.304.07 (a), Cl.304.07 (c)
FREQUENCY: Check prior to placing material

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Material should be spread to minimize number of jointsLongitudinal joints offset from one layer to next by not less than 150mmLongitudinal joints to be located within 300mm from planned traffic lane lines or within 300 mm of the centre of a traffic lane.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. Cl.304.07 (a), Cl.304.07 (d), Cl.304.07 (e)
FREQUENCY: Check prior to placing material
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: A single lot shall be considered a single layer of 4000m2 or one days production in a single layer, whichever is lesser.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. Cl.304.08 (b)(ii) Table 304.111
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Pavement lots should be subject to proof roll as outlined in VicRoads Section 173, under supervision of Superintendent
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. Cl.304.08(b)(iv), Cl. 173
3.1 - Determine Testing Scale & Initial testing frequency
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Table 204.161 from VicRoads Standard nominates the level of testing required for acceptance of Surface Level Measurement.

○ Scale A - Initially test every lot until 3 consecutive lots of like material and/or work have achieved the standards specified in Clauses 304.08. and 304.10. If no failures, Reduced Frequency applies as specified in Table 304.111.
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Document Review/ Site Inspection
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Characteristic Value of Density Ratio for Subbase:- > 97.0% (Scale B) 1 per every lot
○ Minimum number of measurements per lot: 40 For Upper
○ Upper Subbase: Mean + 6mm to - 12mm with a maximum Standard Deviation of 8mm
○ Lower Subbase: Mean +8mm to -16mm with a maximum Standard Deviation of 10mm.
○ Base: Mean ± 8mm with a maximum Standard Deviation of 8mm.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. Table 304.061, Table 304.062
